data.title: Update WebP to 0.5.0
data.body: New versions is much faster than old ones.

data.title: Fix OpenGL macro redefinition warning in JS bindings/Mac
data.body:
When I build `libjscocos2d Mac` on Xcode 7, I get the following warning:

```
cocos/platform/mac/CCGL-mac.h:44:9: 'glReleaseShaderCompiler' macro redefined
cocos/scripting/js-bindings/manual/jsb_opengl_manual.h:42:13: Previous definition is here
```

I think JS bindings can use `#include "platform/CCGL.h"` instead of the macro redefinition in `jsb_opengl_manual.h`. This PR improves and fixes the warning, thanks.

data.title: cocostudio on mac: issue with percentage positions and sizes (c++)
data.body:
When positions or sizes set to percentages them are rounded down. 

E.g. if it set to 250% it will be rounded to 200%, if it set to 75% - it will be rounded to 0%.

http://discuss.cocos2d-x.org/t/cocostudio-percentage-positions-and-sizes-issue/25739

cocostudio 2.3.3
cocos2d-x 3.9
mac os x

data.title: 3 10 stand alone test
data.body:
- adds a stand along test to test GC. "js-tests" is so big that it is impossible to test it.
- fixes memory leak when "subclassing" (extending) native objects

Status of the bindings:
- native objects and "extended" objects work as expected. They are freed when the GC collects them
- every one and then there are a few crashes when using the new memory model. I guess it is related to events... more debugging is needed
- GC doesn't collect the objects immediately... not sure why... I think @pandamicro knows why

data.title: Bug for convert std::string between C++ and Lua, the binaray string will be cut off.
data.body:
**BUG**
`tolua_pushcppstring` just convert the `str.c_str()` to function `lua_pushstring`,  and the `lua_pushstring` use function `strlen` to get the length of the string. Consider that the `str` is a binary string and contains '\0', the whole string will be cut off during the conversion. The behaviour of `tolua_tocppstring` is same as `tolua_pushcpptring`.

**SOLUTION**
Modify `tools/bindings-generator/targets/lua/conversions.yaml`, use function `stdstring_to_luaval` to replace `tolua_pushcpptring`.
 Function `luaval_to_std_string` should use `lua_tolstring` to do conversion , and `stdstring_to_luaval` should use  `lua_pushlstring` to do conversion.

data.title: GLViewImpl::createWithRect for Window Desktop, the height is limited at 883.000f with v3.9
data.body:
Hi,

When i use GLViewImpl::createWithRect(name, Rect(0,0,width,height)) to create a game window (for testing many resolution look purpose. While the width is changed as i wants, the height is limited at 883.

For example: with width = 640, height = 480 => getFrameSize() will get the result:  width = 640, height = 480.
But  width = 640, height = 960  => getFrameSize() will get the result:  width = 640, height = 883.
width = 1536, height = 2048 => getFrameSize() will get the result:  width = 1536, height = 883.

This bug won't happen with the older version

data.title: [android] Include stdint.h for uint32_t in UIWebViewImpl-android.h
data.body:
This fixes compilation error when building cocos2d-x demo by CrystaX NDK.

According to [POSIX](http://pubs.opengroup.org/onlinepubs/9699919799/basedefs/stdint.h.html), `uint32_t` is defined in "stdint.h", so if you use it in code, you should include "stdint.h".

In Google's Android NDK it works because their "iosfwd" include "stdint.h" implicitly; however, it's not a requirement and you shouldn't rely on that.

With this fix, cocos2d-x demo getting built no matter which NDK is used - CrystaX or Google's one.
